list_page_teaser: Avon Barksdale's warm personality is radically different from the cool temperament of his business partner and once-close friend Stringer Bell's.  Click to learn more!
description_html:
These images show the personalities of Avon and Stringer are as different as night and day. Both are decisive and keep their cards close to the vest, but Avon's warmth and pragmatism contrast strongly with Stringer's cool demeanor and his ability to recognize patterns and relationships in the chaos of Baltimore's urban crime environment.

If Stringer and Avon are the head and the heart of the Barksdale organization, soldiers like Wee Bey and Slim Charles are the arms and legs. Their portraits show they are both open to direction and willing to carry out their orders with pragmatic, ruthless efficiency.

image_list.title: Avon Barksdale
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Avon's spiritual portrait shows he is ______________.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Avon's dominant personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.

The Yellow in Avon's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of facts than of ideas; need for sensual stimulation.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Introverts, the dominant trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Avon's auxiliary personality trait, Feeling: passion; amiability; friendliness; compassion; warmth; very slight/moderate/strong preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in Avon's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/subjective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being emotional/personal/subjective rather than logical/impersonal/objective.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.

The Blue in Stringer's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of ideas than of facts; need for intellectual stimulation.
